ExampleDefinition.Description:
Demonstrates how to place the trading annotations, that are commonly used in trading and financial applications over a chart by click in realtime as well as in code-behind.
The Trading annotations are created via TradingAnnotationCreationModifier, or with TradingAnnotationCreationModifierMvvm in MVVM. TradingAnnotationCreationModifier is derived from AnnotationsBase.
You can find more information on this, following this links:
- [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#Intro%20to%20the%20Annotations%20API.html']AnnotationCreationModifier[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#MVVM%20Annotations%20API.html']MVVM Annotations API[/url]
In order to create the annotation in code-behind or in ViewModelyou will use method SetBasePoint (iComparable x, iComparable y).
[b]Annotation Types Include:[/b]
- [url='link?']AxisMarkerAnnotation[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/todo']BrushAnnotation[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/todo']ElliotWaveAnnotation[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/todo']XabcdAnnotation[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/todo']HeadAndShouldersAnnotation[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/todo']FibonacciRetracementAnnotation[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/todo']FibonacciExtensionAnnotation[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/todo']PitchforkAnnotation[/url]
You can change styling of the annotations by changing the annotation properties such as line color and thickness, as well as fill color.
